derivation.yuyuan_name: late Old English: from Latin fons, 'font- spring, fountain', occurring in the ecclesiastical Latin phrase fons or fontes baptismi 'baptismal water(s')
late 16th cent. (denoting the action or process of casting or founding): from French fonte, from fondre 'to melt'

entry.def: In printing, a font is a set of characters of the same style and size.

entry.tran: 洗礼盆，圣水盂(教堂中洗礼用)
entry.def: In a church, a font is a bowl which holds the water used for baptisms.

means.word_mean: 1. a specific size and style of type within a type family
